content: Several [units of measurement](/wiki/Units_of_measurement) were historically used in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) to measure length, mass, and volume. During 1968â€“1970, the [metric system](/wiki/Metric_system) was adopted in Singapore. The metric system is used for most official purposes and only metric measures are permitted for trade. Despite these restrictions, fabric is still commonly sold by the square yard. ## System during the later half of the 19th century Several units were used in Singapore under [Straits Settlements](/wiki/Straits_Settlements). ### Length units - 1 cubit (aka. hasta) = 18 inches which is equal to 45.72 cm. ### Mass units - 1 [mace](/wiki/Mace_(unit)) (aka. miam) = 52 [grain](/wiki/Grain_(unit)) equal to 3.36954 grams. - 1 buncal (for gold) = 822 [grain](/wiki/Grain_(unit)) equal to 53.2647 grams.
title: Singaporean units of measurement
